intro: Armeria maritima var. matritensis, commonly known as the Spanish matrimony vine, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It is a member of the carnation family (Caryophyllaceae) and is characterized by its clusters of pink or white flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy, well-drained soils. It produces small, rounded leaves and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
